context: Öljy is the Finnish word for oil. It can refer to various types of oils, including cooking oil (ruokaöljy), crude oil (raakaöljy), and lubricating oil used in engines. The word declines based on case, as shown in the dictionary definitions provided. For example, 'öljyn' means 'of oil', while 'öljyä' is used for the partitive case indicating an indefinite amount of oil.
